title: German Currywurst Recipe
description: Currywurst is a popular 'fast food' in Berlin, Germany. It is quick and simple and everyone loves it! If you're in a hurry, you can substitute ketchup for the sauce, or use your own recipe.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines European German German Currywurst 3.8 (98) 75 Reviews 7 Photos Currywurst is a popular 'fast food' in Berlin, Germany. It is quick and simple and everyone loves it! If you're in a hurry, you can substitute ketchup for the sauce, or use your own recipe. Submitted by JenFen Updated on November 21, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 7 7 7 7 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 4 Yield: 4 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 3 (15 ounce) cans tomato sauce 1 pound kielbasa 2 tablespoons chili sauce ½ teaspoon onion salt 1 tablespoon white sugar 1 teaspoon ground black pepper 1 pinch paprika Curry powder to taste Directions Preheat oven to Broil/Grill. Pour tomato sauce into a large saucepan, then stir in the chili sauce, onion salt, sugar and pepper. Let simmer over medium heat, occasionally stirring; bring to a gentle boil and reduce heat to low. Simmer another 5 minutes. Meanwhile, broil/grill kielbasa sausage for 3 to 4 minutes each side, or until cooked through. Slice into pieces 1/4 inch to 1/2 inch thick. Pour tomato sauce mixture over sausage, then sprinkle all with paprika and curry powder and serve. I Made It Print 135 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 451 Calories 32g Fat 26g Carbs 18g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 451 % Daily Value * Total Fat 32g 41% Saturated Fat 11g 53% Cholesterol 75mg 25% Sodium 3019mg 131% Total Carbohydrate 26g 9% Dietary Fiber 5g 18% Total Sugars 18g Protein 18g 37% Vitamin C 24mg 26% Calcium 67mg 5% Iron 5mg 25% Potassium 1432mg 30% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of German Currywurst 01 of 07 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 07 Photo by  emmajane 07/18/2016 03 of 07 Photo by  Patrick Smith 12/14/2015 04 of 07 Photo by  wally jacobs 05/04/2015 05 of 07 Photo by  witchywoman 05/20/2010 These were really good...I did not use all the tomato sauce as I thought it was a bit excessive, but the sauce reminded me of Spaghetti-O's...super good! 06 of 07 Photo by  STRUDELQUEEN 09/20/2006 I love this easy recipe. When I make it (I am Austrian)in the U.S., I grill the sausage (jumbo hot dogs or bratwurst) and use ketchup mixed with curry. For appearance I sprinkle a little bit of curry on top. This makes it very easy. Serve it with a crips Kaiserroll and use toothpicks for eating. I submitted a photo which looks pretty authentic. 1 You’ll Also Love Wisconsin Bratwurst 454 Ratings Sheboygan Grilled Brats 94 Ratings Sausage 'n Kraut 13 Ratings Beer Steak 105 Ratings Souvlaki 1,046 Ratings Grilled Italian Pork Chops 66 Ratings German Schwenkbraten 25 Ratings Bistecca alla Fiorentina (Tuscan Porterhouse) 19 Ratings Beer Glazed Brats and Sauerkraut 86 Ratings Homemade Italian Sausage 30 Ratings Gyros Burgers 295 Ratings Pineapple Bacon Burgers 127 Ratings Festival-Style Grilled Italian Sausage Sandwiches 59 Ratings Greek Bifteki (Beef Patties) 58 Ratings Thai-Style Ground Pork Skewers 8 Ratings Greek Souzoukaklia 105 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: JenFen
instructions: Preheat oven to Broil/Grill.;Pour tomato sauce into a large saucepan, then stir in the chili sauce, onion salt, sugar and pepper. Let simmer over medium heat, occasionally stirring; bring to a gentle boil and reduce heat to low. Simmer another 5 minutes.;Meanwhile, broil/grill kielbasa sausage for 3 to 4 minutes each side, or until cooked through. Slice into pieces 1/4 inch to 1/2 inch thick.;Pour tomato sauce mixture over sausage, then sprinkle all with paprika and curry powder and serve.
